name: Questions Posed in Pre-90's Lyrics, Part III Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Now, who will light up the darkness?  Who will hold your hand?  Who will find you the answers when you don't understand?  Why should I have to be the one who has to convince you?"
questions.explanation:
Genesis.

	From "Throwing It All Away," off of Genesis' 1986 album "Invisible Touch."

questions.text: "Who's gonna pick your world up off of the ground?  Who's gonna chase away the tears you cry?  Who's gonna love you, baby, as good as I?"
questions.explanation:
Heart.

	From "Who Will You Run To?", a tune with a grammatically problematic title -- although the lines above actually use pronouns correctly! -- from Heart's 1989 album "Bad Animals."

questions.text: "Where have all the good men gone, and where are all the gods?  Where's the streetwise Hercules to fight the rising odds?"
questions.explanation:
Bonnie Tyler.

	"Holding Out For a Hero" appeared on the soundtrack of the 1984 film "Footloose."

questions.text: "Don't you feel like trying something new?  Don't you feel like breaking out, or breaking us in two?"
questions.explanation:
Joe Jackson.

	The opening lines of "Breaking Us In Two," the second hit from Jackson's seminal 1982 album "Night and Day."  (The first, and possibly more notable hit, was "Steppin' Out."  Remember that one?)

questions.text: "What's your price for flight in finding Mister Right?"
questions.explanation:
Night Ranger.

	From "Sister Christian," the mega-hit that highlighted the 1983 album "Midnight Madness."  (I still have no idea what this line means, by the way.)

questions.text: "If my best isn't good enough, then how can it be good enough for two?"
questions.explanation:
Wham!.

	From "Everything She Wants," one of several chart-toppers from the 1984 album "Make It Big."

questions.text: "Anybody here see the noise?  See the fear and commotion?  I think we missed it!"
questions.explanation:
The Guess Who.

	From "Hand Me Down World," a release off of the 1970 album "Share the Land."

questions.text: "Is there something I should say that'll make you come my way?  Do you feel the same?  'Cause you don't let it show..."
questions.explanation:
Duran Duran.

	From the chorus of "Is There Something I Should Know?", which first appeared on Duran Duran's self-titled 1981 album.

questions.text: "Where does it stop?  Where do you dare me to draw the line?"
questions.explanation:
Hall and Oates.

	From "I Can't Go For That (No Can Do)," a number one hit from the 1981 album "Private Eyes."

Tina Turner.

	One can find this line in "What's Love Got To Do With It?", Tina's big comeback song from 1984's "Private Dancer" album.
